intro: Fishlockia anegadensis, commonly known as the Anegada fishlock, is a flowering plant native to the British Virgin Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with red stamens. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
